identificationModule.briefTitle: Personalized Evidence-based Medicine in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation
identificationModule.officialTitle: Personalized Evidence-based Medicine Improves Outcomes of Anticoagulation Therapy in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation

collaborators.name: Center for New Medical Technologies, Novosibirsk, Russia
I.M. Sechenov First Moscow State Medical University
Federal State Budgetary Institution, V. A. Almazov Federal North-West Medical Research Centre, of the Ministry of Health

descriptionModule.detailedDescription: 4200 EMR of patients at high risk for stroke with 1-year follow-up will be enrolled in the current study and analyzed by clinical decision support systems (CDSS MedicBK) utilizing a core laboratory.

conditions: Adherence to Personalized EBM Anticoagulant Treatment in Patients at High Risk for Stroke

interventions.name: anticoagulation treatment
interventions.description: Adherence to personalized evidence-based anticoagulant treatment in patients at high risk for stroke with atrial fibrillation

primaryOutcomes.measure: The percentage of guideline-based and personalized EBM recommendations
primaryOutcomes.description: The percentage of guideline-based and personalized EBM recommendations acted on by clinicians for anticoagulant therapy in patients with AF. All discrepancies between routine and CDSS-recommended treatment resulting in frame of guideline-based therapy and personalized EBM therapy will be adjudicated by core laboratory.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Quantify the performance of the CDSS (MedicBK) algorithm
secondaryOutcomes.description: Quantify the performance of the CDSS (MedicBK) algorithm for presents treatment suggestions in frame of guideline-based therapy and personalized EBM therapy: the sensitivity, specificity, NPV, and PPV

Outcomes for all-cause mortality, thromboembolism (TE), bleeding, and the composite endpoint of any thromboembolism, cardiovascular death, or bleeding in relation to whether they were guideline-based treatment or personalized EBM treatment. Thromboembolism refers to stroke, transient ischemic attack, acute coronary syndrome, coronary intervention, cardiac arrest, peripheral embolism, and pulmonary embolism
Predictors of guideline-based and personalized EBM adherence

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

EMR only if an ECG diagnosis (12-lead ECG, 24-h Holter, or other electrocardiographic documentation) confirming AF was made in patients at high risk for stroke by CHA2DS2-VASc (≥2 in men and ≥3 in women).

Exclusion Criteria:

No
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients at high risk for stroke with atrial fibrillation

overallOfficials.name: Evgeny Pokushalov, Prof. MD PhD
overallOfficials.affiliation: Center for New Medical Technologies, Novosibirsk, Russia
